explanations.clustering: The paper uses topological data analysis (TDA) to map firms' locations in technological space, which involves clustering high-dimensional data into a shape graph.
explanations.principal components analysis: The method involves reducing high-dimensional patent data into a more manageable form, similar to the dimensionality reduction techniques used in PCA.
explanations.manifold learning: The topological data analysis approach can be seen as a form of manifold learning, as it aims to represent high-dimensional data in a lower-dimensional space while preserving its structure.
explanations.feature representation: The paper discusses representing firms' inventive activities in a high-dimensional technological space, which involves creating meaningful feature representations of the data.
